722991f-a.text:
Rivington Street, north side, at Columbia Street. The view shows the De Witt Memorial Church at No. 280 Rivington Street, between Columbia and Cannon Streets. These buildings are reported to be over congested; 1 building having 98 people in 62 rooms.

About 1920.
NEG # 3445
722991f-a.folder: Rivington Street & Columbia Street, Manhattan, NY

732927f-a.title: Social conditions - [Interior of a three-room apartment.]
732927f-a.text:
Social Conditions in Manhattan: The interior of a 3 room apartment at No. 262 Rivington Street, showing the quarters occupied by a father and mother, 8 children and a boarder- 11 in all. The foreground shows the "dining room" with two beds (one folding) and an ice box denoting the rooms original purpose. Through the kitchen, one comes upon the bedroom; a small space, two-thirds of which is occupied by its only furnishing. Note the attempt to make this crowded flat an attractive, clean home.

November 15, 1923.

Gift of New York World.
Neg. # 2474

Slide # 188

733295f-a.title: Street scenes - Cigar store - Indian.
733295f-a.text:
125 Columbia Street, east side, south of Kane Street, showing a wooden
indian, once commonly used to indicate a cigar store.
August 10, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.

719049f-a.text:
69 Columbia Street, west side, between Rivington and Delancey Streets, showing frame house is rear of No. 69

F.L. Sperr
719049f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

719050f-a.text:
68 to 72 Columbia Street, east side, south of Rivington Street, showing prominently the synagogue of the Congregation Ahavath Achim Ansche Ungarn at No. 70. At the left margin is a portion of No. 74, the tenement at the S. E. corner of Rivington Street.

NEG: 2917

May 12, 1939

P. L. Sperr
719050f-a.folder: Columbia Street & Rivington Street, Manhattan, NY

719051f-a.text:
Columbia Street, east side, north from Rivington Street, showing a glimpse of the congested ghetto under the Williamsburg Bridge. Note the pushcarts and the modern garbage removal truck of the Department of Sanitation.

June 29, 1938.

P.L. Sperr

View No. 2 is the same area at a later date. Note the vacant
spaces caused by recent tenement demolitions.

May 12, 1939

P. L. Sperr

Neg. # 5060
